SENT.plain: We present three patients who were admitted to our institution with vertebrobasilar dolichoectasia diagnosed at CT angiography
Two patients had associated intraarterial thrombi and one patient had basilar artery dissection
Shaded surface display images were useful in showing arterial anatomy relative to the skull base
Source images and curved-reformatted images were helpful in diagnosing thrombi and dissection
CT angiography is a minimally invasive means of diagnosing and following up these patients
